confusables: 1. we're, were, where
2. where , wherefore (see usage note at the current entry)

supplementaryNotes.content: Where … at ( Where was he at? ) and where … to ( Where is this leading to? ) are often criticized as redundant because neither at nor to adds anything to the meaning of where, and sentences like the preceding ones are perfectly clear and standard without the final at or to. This criticism does not apply to where … from, which is fully standard: Where does the money come from? The constructions where … at and where … to occur in the speech of educated people but are rare in formal speech and edited writing.

exampleSentences.sentence: You will not succeed in wresting it for long from the eternal oblivion where-unto it is destined.
Where-ever a sale was effected, all those connected with it were objects of vengeance.

source.title: The History of England in Three Volumes, Vol.III.
source.author: E. Farr and E. H. Nolan

exampleSentences.sentence: He peeped over the hill, and saw two warriors riding away toward the Place-where-the-sun-sleeps.
"We saw some people far away toward the Place-where-the-day-begins," said High Eagle.
He afterwards went to the Apartment of the Empresses, and had reason, where-ever he came, to be satisfied with his Reception.

source.title: The Memoirs of Charles-Lewis, Baron de Pollnitz, Volume II
source.author: Karl Ludwig von Pllnitz

exampleSentences.sentence: As they are rich, they can easily afford to make a good Appearance where-ever they come.

source.title: The Memoirs of Charles-Lewis, Baron de Pollnitz, Volume I
source.author: Karl Ludwig von Pllnitz

exampleSentences.sentence: The reputation of this learned youth spread every-where; and learned men spoke of him in their works as a prodigy.

source.title: The Life of the Truly Eminent and Learned Hugo Grotius
source.author: Jean Lvesque de Burigny

exampleSentences.sentence: It meant the eternal question of what shall we eat, and what shall we drink, and where-withal shall we be clothed?
"Waste no powder; fire at discretion; and where-ever you discover a head, pick it off," were Washington's instructions to his men.

source.title: From Farm House to the White House
source.author: William M. Thayer

exampleSentences.sentence: This point is easy to find, for it is placed where-ever feminine qualities are to be generalized.
